intro: Scleromitrion nitidum, commonly known as the smoothleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are typically smooth and glossy. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in summer, often in clusters along the stems. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Scleromitrion nitidum is often found in open habitats such as slopes, gravelly plains, and disturbed areas.
